sentences.en: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.cn: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.en: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.cn: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.en: He looked round fiercely, daring them to contradict.
sentences.cn: 他狂野地环顾着四周, 挑战似地看看有谁反驳.

sentences.en: His private actions are in direct contradiction to / with ( ie directly contradict ) his publicly expressed opinions.
sentences.cn: 他私下的行为跟公开的言论完全是两码事.

sentences.en: I am not in a position either to contradict or affirm this statement.
sentences.cn: 我既不能否定这一说法,又不能肯定这一说法.

sentences.en: People in Pisa were angry with Galileo for daring to contradict the great Aristotle.
sentences.cn: 比萨的人们对伽里略极为气恼,因为他竟敢于对抗伟大的亚里士多德.

sentences.en: Relativity does not contradict the older mechanics but generalizes it.
sentences.cn: 相对论并不与较老的力学相矛盾,而是使之推广.

sentences.en: She waxes righteously indignant if anyone tries to contradict her.
sentences.cn: 如果有人想反驳她,她说起话来就会义愤填膺.

sentences.en: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.cn: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

sentences.en: The two accounts contradict each other.
The two market reports contradict each other.
sentences.cn: 这两份市况报告互相矛盾.

sentences.en: The witness statements contradict each other and the facts remain unclear.
sentences.cn: 目击者的说法互相矛盾，真相依然未明。

sentences.en: They contradict each other all the time.
This last equation does not contradict the entropy - of - mixing formula.
sentences.cn: 此式与混合熵公式并不矛盾.

sentences.en: Young children should never contradict what their parents say.
sentences.cn: 孩子们绝对不应顶撞父母.

sentences.en: Your actions contradict your declared moral principles.
sentences.cn: 你的行为违背了你宣称的道德准则.
你的行为与你的道义相矛盾.

words.tran_cn: 矛盾的；反对的；反驳的；抗辩的

trans.tran_en: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true
if one statement, story etc contradicts another, the facts in it are different so that both statements cannot be true
